Comments_List: Knowledge of history of civil society theory, increased sense of how cultural sociology shapes civil society theory, learned how to engage civil sphere theory with contemporary empirical research

This course is most certainly a specialty course, and requires a lot of background knowledge of social theory. I think that the student engagement would be improved if the students were either given the opportunity to review foundations like Durkheim and Weber and Marx, etc... or that there was a prerequisite required to take the class. It would make a great series with social theory and cultural sociology. I think this would bring the engagement up higher. Also, more structured facilitation for discussion would be helpful.
Yes, to a sociology student who was familiar with the foundations of social theory needed to succeed in the course
